story.description:
Implement HAIAMM Security Requirements (SR) practice at Level 1 maturity.

## Practice Overview

**Function:** Building
**Purpose:** Define security requirements for AI systems

## Level 1 Objectives

Establish basic security requirements for AI system inputs, outputs, access, and data.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Input requirements defined
  - Maximum input length specified
  - Prohibited content patterns listed
  - Rate limiting thresholds set
  - Encoding requirements documented

- [ ] Output requirements defined
  - Sensitive data filtering rules
  - Response length limits
  - Format validation requirements
  - Error message standards

- [ ] Access requirements defined
  - Authentication requirements
  - Authorization levels
  - API key management rules
  - Session handling requirements

- [ ] Data requirements defined
  - Allowed data types
  - Retention policies
  - Privacy requirements
  - Classification standards

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Requirements documented in catalog
- [ ] Development team briefed
- [ ] Requirements integrated into templates

## OWASP Risks Addressed

- LLM01: Prompt Injection
- LLM05: Improper Output Handling
- LLM10: Unbounded Consumption
- ASI03: Identity & Privilege Abuse
- ASI05: Unexpected Code Execution

## Resources

- [SR Practice Guide](https://github.com/R3v3rzk1mur4/HAIAMM/docs/practices/SR-Software-OnePager.md)

## Verifhai Integration

Use `/verifhai-practice SR` for guided requirements development.

subtasks.description: Document length limits, content patterns, rate limits for AI inputs.
